cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 550 miles SSE of Cameron, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northwest across the south-central Gulf, then turning NNW–N toward the southwest Louisiana coast before accelerating NNE inland Friday night
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just east of Cameron, southwestern Louisiana

weather_observation.watch_coast: High Island, TX to Grand Isle, LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from the upper Texas shoreline eastward across Louisiana and into Mississippi–Alabama
weather_observation.wind: 59% chance of sustained 34-kt winds with a 22% chance of 50-kt; brief hurricane-force gusts (10% chance) cannot be ruled out Friday evening.
weather_observation.storm_surge: NHC storm-surge watch indicates 2–4 ft of inundation possible from High Island, TX to Cameron, LA, including Sabine Lake/Port Arthur.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain on the western flank of Delta could bring 2–4 in., with isolated totals near or just above 4 in., Friday–Saturday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf/rip currents beginning Thursday and a low tornado risk in outer rain bands Friday.
